content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Iron Smelting Furnace at position (5.0, 5.0)
Consists of a furnace located at (5.0, 5.0) that is used to convert iron ore into iron plates. This structure was employed to boost the overall iron-plate count through a controlled smelting process.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of a furnace located at (-27.0, -60.0) that is used to convert copper ore into copper plates. This structure supports production by processing copper ore into a more usable form via smelting.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Usage Errors – When calling get_entities, avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or providing unexpected positional arguments. Always verify the function’s signature to ensure correct parameter usage.
  
• Null Iterable Handling – Before iterating over the results (for example, when filtering labs), ensure that the returned value is not None. Use a fallback (such as an empty list) when necessary to prevent TypeError exceptions.
  
• Lab Crafting and Placement – Repeated failures in both crafting and placement of the Lab are tied to insufficient sub-ingredients (for instance, iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables). Confirm that all necessary resources and intermediate products are available and that the inventory contains the Lab before attempting placement.
  
• Resource Production Chain – Errors indicating that items like iron-plate or copper-plate “cannot be crafted” underline the need to verify that smelting and other production processes are properly set up. Ensure that furnaces are receiving the correct inputs and that the production chain for sub-ingredients is fully operational before initiating lab production.
